title: 114_hr4302
content: The Secretary is responsible for resolving and terminating all functions of the Bank as outlined in the Act. Functions transferred to the Secretary will end once all obligations are satisfied. A report must be submitted to Congress upon completion. The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for implementing the Act, including the administration and dissolution of functions transferred to them, resolving outstanding obligations of the Federal Government, and taking necessary actions to dissolve any remaining affairs of the Bank. They may delegate functions as needed and no positions or functions of the Bank are authorized after 60 days of abolishment. Conforming amendments and repeals are also outlined in the Act. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed, including sections from various Acts. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions, including sections from various Acts, are repealed. Amendments from 1978 to various Acts are also repealed, including sections from the Bank Export Services Act, Public Law 90-390, the Trade and Development Enhancement Act of 1983, the Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act of 1990, the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988, and title 31 of the United States Code. The text chunk discusses the elimination of certain positions and provisions related to the Export-Import Bank, including the removal of specific items from title 5 and the elimination of the Office of Inspector General for the Bank. The text chunk discusses the removal of specific items from title 5 and the elimination of the Office of Inspector General for the Export-Import Bank, with the repeals and amendments taking effect on the abolishment date. Additionally, a report to Congress on other necessary amendments to Federal statutes is required. SEC. 10. REFERENCES. Any reference in Federal laws, orders, rules, or documents to a department or office being transferred by this Act will now refer to the new department or office. SEC. 11. DEFINITIONS. "Function" includes duties, powers, and programs, while "office" encompasses various organizational entities.
